results.title: Take me out to the ball game
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Busby Berkeley
results.brief_description: To keep themselves occupied during the off season, Wolves baseball players O’Brien and Ryan (Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra) moonlight as a song and dance team, much to the chagrin of more dedicated players on the team such as Goldberg (Jules Munshin). When training begins for the new season, they are surprised to learn that the new coach - K C Higgins, is keen to take a more active role in coaching. Fearing the worst, O’Brien and Ryan are pleasantly surprised to learn that the new coach is an attractive woman (Esther Williams) who knows her way around the baseball field. Friendly rivalry rears its head as the two friends both fall for the new coach, but eventually she must decide on one, and does so by choosing O’Brien. All is not lost for Ryan either, who finds himself in the arms of Shirley. O’Brien and Ryans love for vaudeville could be the undoing of the teams success however, as O’Brien is approached with a bribe by Gambler Joe Lorgan (Edward Arnold) to ditch baseball for the entertainment industry. Musical numbers staged by Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly. Cast also includes Betty Garrett, Edward Arnold and Jules Munshin.

results.title: Take heart
results.creator_credit: Film and Television Institute (W.A.), Women's Film Fund AFC and Penny Cordell
results.brief_description: Western Australia nuclar disarmament protesters tell how they became active protesters against the United States nuclear ships using Coburn Sound. With the help of Dr Helen Caldicott the Nuclear Disarmement Party was formed in 1948 and they campaigned to have Senator Jo Valentine elected to the Australian Parliament. Shows how a small grassroots level group can succed in political ctivity.

results.title: Take care of yourself
results.creator_credit: John Dickinson & Co Ltd and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Two young people starting work in a paper works enact a series of accidents of the types common to most factories. The story points the moral that such accidents can be prevented by thought and care.

results.title: Take a ride
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Commonwealth Department of Transport, Don Murray and David E. Barrow
results.brief_description: Because of increased traffic congestion, State Governments are taking new initiatives in transport planning, especially in the area of public transport. Looks at the different transport systems in each state, and improvements planned.

results.title: Take a look 2
results.creator_credit: TV Ontario and Milton van der Veen
results.brief_description: Set in the country, this series takes a hands-on approach to the principles of science. Kate returns in this series with a new friend, Jamie, and together they explore the natural environment. Kate teaches Jamie about plant and animal life, basic astronomy, geology and meteorology. They experiment with household items and investigate the principles that underly everyday occurrences.

results.title: Take a look
results.creator_credit: TV Ontario, Judy Haladay and Milton van der Veen
results.brief_description: This program enables children to discover the role science plays in their daily life. In each program, Jeffrey, a city kid spending his summer on a farm, explores one aspect of science with his friend Kate. She demonstrates a variety of fascinating experiments which children can do in the classroom. Curiosity and inventiveness are stimulated. The 20 ten minute episodes deal with plants, animals, astonomy, seasons, recycling, the weather, geology and basic physical principles.

results.title: Take a little time: infection control at work
results.creator_credit: Tanglefoot Productions, Victoria. Health Dept. AIDS STD Unit, Film Victoria, Hilary Christmas and Fiona Banks
results.brief_description: Designed for emergency care workers and addresses the risks and prevention of the occupational transmission of communicable diseases, particularly HIV and Hepatitis B. Presented by Dr. Gael Jennings and accompanied by a 10p. booklet.

results.title: Take a letter, please
results.brief_description: Shows amusingly how bad dictation destroys stenographers’ morale and wastes valuable office hours. Burlesques the common faults of people who dictate letters, such as: The scatterbrain who isn’t prepared, the speed demon, the dreamer, Mr Mumblemush and Simon Legree. Concludes with a demonstration of the correct method to dictate a letter using a dictagraph machine.
